website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you don't want a noisy machine, but grind results might not meet your expectations.
pros: Stands out for its easy-to-use settings and quiet operation
Has a safety-lock system for added security during use
cons: It produces inconsistent results — some of our testers noted that coarse grinds were present even on fine settings

customer_reviews.title: Too much leftover ground coffee in burrs. Becomes stale, is messy, could clog.
customer_reviews.text: Same as many others have found, the grinder design leaves an unreasonable quantity of ground coffee remaining in the burr area and chute. As much as 11⁄2 tablespoons, just sitting there, getting stale. The easiest way to clean it out is to dump the bean hopper, then remove it and the upper burr, and tip the grinder over above a bowl. This fault in the design also makes for a difficult-to-avoid mess of ground coffee collecting under the drawer. It's also a bit difficult to judge when the drawer is beginning to over-fill, because pile remains at the back of the drawer, in the dark, which then is spilled into the drawer area.
customer_reviews.author: hcw3

customer_reviews.title: If you make a mistake and put the top grinder in upside down ...
customer_reviews.text: The grinder needs cleaning daily because of the residual grounds. Yesterday I put the top grinder in upside down by mistake and now the grinder is inoperable because the top grinder can't be lifted to put it in the right way. It was my error, but it's so easy to make this mistake. Lots of $$ down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was new before I found out coffee grounds inside of the machine. Everything was wrapped to look like new. All the parts made of clear plastic looked new and were in their packaging. When I was placing the bean container, I noticed that the burr had coffee ground.
customer_reviews.author: Pqosirkd

customer_reviews.title: Quality grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality, quiet machine. It looks good on the counter and is fairly compact. The grind settings are adequate for me. I mostly do french press or moka pot. As some have said, there is some amount of static that can attract grounds. It really hasn't been a problem for me. It also seems to randomly occur. You can't beat the grind and quality for the price point of this machine. Edit: I have now had the grinder for several months and it is still great. Actually, the static problem has stopped. I did clean the bin in the sink. I'm not sure if that solved it or if it stopped over time.
customer_reviews.author: Colomarc

customer_reviews.title: my second one after  12 years of use that produces a fine enough gring for a good expresso.
customer_reviews.text: It produces a fine enough grind for a great expresso, and for a price, they are a commercial grinder company that produces this one for home use. I owned this same on for over 12 years, then I went cheap and was not able to get a fine enough gring on three cheaper versions (adding up to a whole lot more, and I could have fixed the other if I had gotten to it before someone else tried to fix it. It is the only grinder after much research that consistently produces a really fine gring, better than the one on my Miele expresso machine costing $1,600.00
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 years, gets messy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this thing for just over four years before it gave out. While it was easy to use and provided a consistent grind, one day it just sporadically stop working. Maybe it would grind for a few seconds, then just started spinning, but not grinding anything. Additionally, it was a bit messy as the catching bin would sometimes (often) get grounds behind it and then pour out later on as well as making putting the bin back in challenging. Would it buy it again? Probably not. I've heard other machines are a bit better with reliability and keeping things clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kannon30

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best for its price range
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for pour over coffee. I did a ton of research and this beat out everything (as of 2019). I personally own a Ceado E37S, yes I'm an espresso snob. I put the Capresso against the Ceado for pour over and it was nearly identical. Grind consistency for pour over at this price is fantastic. Just to be clear, it can't compete/shouldn't even attempt making espresso but for pour over it's amazing. P.S. It doesn't measure the dose (crude dial timer) so pick yourself up a scale if you don't already have one.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: quiet, strong, modified by user for better visibility
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace incredibly loud (louder than the worst blender!) Mr. Coffee burr grinder which, thankfully, broke. This model cost substantially more, but "one gets what one pays for" usually. PROS: relatively quiet (loudness similar to a power drill), plenty of power, easy to clean CONS: black body + clear receptacle cup = hard to see dark coffee grounds in the cup on groggy mornings; clear lid design is so clear that one can hardly see that the lid is on or not So I masked, lightly sanded, and spray painted the bottom, back, and sides of the cup, and the inside of the lid, solving both issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job grinding coffee, but makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grinder, and we use it daily, but it builds up static electric charges and when the drawer is removed, coffee grounds fly everywhere making a mess. Additionally, coffee escapes during the grinding process so that residue remains and tends to displace the drawer when reinserted. One must clean that receiving area carefully, or the mess will be worse every time. We have even tried using an antistatic device to eliminate static electric charges to no avail. Otherwise, a nice grinder.
customer_reviews.author: MacWiz

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Capresso burr grinder I've had. The first one was several years old but suddenly died, so this is a replacement. I've had other grinders but none works as well as this one. One thing I like is that it's easy to grind a bit more if you need to. Simply turn the knob a bit and release it. No need to reset to a different amount as with some other grinders.
customer_reviews.author: W. Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Capresso Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this capresso coffee grinder for a while now. It is less noisy than our old one that is for sure. I like everything about it except the measuring of the coffee. It would be helpful to have a measuring device that you could read to measure the beans for the correct amount for various cups of coffee. Still like the machine. It is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: susjean

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Poorly designed.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed. Cannot be assembled. Capresso must have received many complaints about this issue because the box contained a special yellow addendum to the instruction manual cautioning users to line up the black dot on the bean reservoir with the shape on the base. Well, we did that. Many times. And it still wouldn't fit. Apprears to be designed poorly or mismanufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Mama T

customer_reviews.title: The Capresso is a far better machine. I’ve taken the Encore apart several times ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for Baratza Encore based on the Amazon reviews. We used the Encore multiple times daily to grind beans for a Chemex and expresso for several years. The Capresso is a far better machine. I’ve taken the Encore apart several times to clean it. I can immediately see during assembly the Capresso is a far better machine. It grinds great and is extremely quiet. We are not having static issues. Hands down far superior to the Encore. This is a great grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality coffee grinder, holds a lot of beans
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder. Hopper can hold alot of beans. We drink quite a bit of coffee so that is nice feature. It does grind very fine to drip coffee well, however I think the French press setting could be a little coarser, in my opinion. Also I did have a little issue putting on the hopper, it normally pops right into track but I had some issues getting it into place. That could have just been operator error. Static does build up in the coffee ground container. I control that by adding a few drops of water to the hopper before starting to grind. All that being said, I still think this is a great coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder for the price
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I really wanted a Baratza Encore, but for the money (about half the price at the time) and based on positive feedback from friends who have these, I purchased it. It seems to be built well, is a good size and works as I'd expect. My only complaints are that it has a few less grind settings than the baratza and the detents are kind of "soft" when selecting a grind size. I haven't compared them side by side but have heard that it doesn't get quite as course at the encore for French press, but honestly its worked very well for the money and I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again at the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The unit has consistently ground coffee for two years, probably about a thousand uses. The plastic cup at the bottom recently cracked. The service and price for replacing the cup was very good. Another small problem is that the screen printing marking grind coarseness has rubbed off. The burr grinder itself seems well designed and performance has not decreased. The grind is consistent and controllable. Even with these small problems, I like this company and their products. I will likely buy this grinder again when the unit eventually stops working.
customer_reviews.author: D. Com

customer_reviews.title: Few helpful hints
customer_reviews.text: I've used this grinder for about three months now and do like it. My main complaint is that it is difficult to clean. The tiny brush that is provided is worthless. I use a small basting brush, similar in appearance to a paint brush, with good results. Also add two or three drops of water to the beans before grinding to prevent static cling. 2/3 of a cup of beans will make 12, 6 ounce cups of coffee. Add a few drops of pure vanilla extract to the ground coffee to remove any bitterness and you will have a perfect pot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: A. FAN

customer_reviews.title: This burr grinder does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice burr grinder, it will produce any grind I want from fine to a nice course that I us in my cold brew. Cleaning this is a bit awkward and some coffee hangs up in the main housing I use a tooth brush to get the nooks and crannies and sometime I just take it outside to use a leak blower haha but it works just be careful not to lose rubber collar that sits on top of grinder set it comes off easily. Once you get used to it cleaning isn't too much of a pain. Grinder do make noise but this one isn't too bad. Overall this is a great grinder
customer_reviews.author: ty grant

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Love my burr grinder, I have waited for months to review because I wanted to give an informed review. The noise level is what I would consider normal for grinding beans. But I live alone and don’t worry about waking anyone. Cleaning is easy, I almost bought some special brushes and pellets, but they aren’t necessary. I bought a cheap toothbrush to use for brushing the inside clean. I have limited counter space so I’m happy that it isn’t too big. Overall, I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grind for 7+ Years and Still Going
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder over 7 years ago and I've never had an issue with it. Grinds are consistent (mostly coarse for French press), fast and it's easy to meter amount produced. Build quality is very good--I thump grinder pretty firmly after use to knock final grounds out of shoot (a design flaw, or just how oily grounds behave?). Grinder is also easy to disassemble for cleaning (or you can just run uncooked rice through it now and again--makes a good rice meal). Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Angst

customer_reviews.title: Good grind
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grinder. It has a nice, even grind, a good capacity, and it looks nice. It's not too loud. There is some static, but if I let it sit for a bit after grinding (fill the coffeemaker with water, get the filter, etc), I just tap the container on the counter and the static dissipates.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gale

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this 7 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: If you're grinding coffee with a grinder with blades you don't know what coffee is supposed to taste like, buy this. I use this every day for 7 years making pour overs, sometimes 2 times a day. Still going strong like it was new. Amazing value for your money. Adjustment works well, I can click one up or down to adjust the time the water runs through the coffee by 15 seconds or so a half click. Made a huge difference in what I could accomplish in flavor in my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent grinding and lack of range of grind variability
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have the range of grind settings as claimed. It falters with fine grinds and (somewhat puzzlingly) with coarse grinds for French press. The setting between the coarsest grind and one notch finer is disproportionately wide. One is beans partially ground like in halves and bits, and the next step finer is perculator grind.
customer_reviews.author: LKS

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly convenient and quiet grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is so much quieter compared to a blade grinder. I also read many reviews before purchasing this. I was very skeptical Due to the fact that many reviewer‘s commented on the static discharge as well as the mess that it would make when you open the been after grinding. Thankfully I experience no such thing. This machine has not yet made a mess. When I pull open the ground coffee bin, the coffee ground does not explode or go all over the place. If it helps, I live in the Pacific Northwest
customer_reviews.author: Han-hsuan Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is actually our second Capresso. We bought the first on the recommendation of a friendly barista, but it had an unfortunate encounter with a cat or we'd still be using it after something like ten years. In short, it's sturdy, easy to use and does a good job of grinding our morning coffee. A bit noisy, but that doesn't last long. It does tend to generate a bit of static with dry beans, but a few drops of water on the beans prior to grinding fix that issue.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Liking It
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long but it has not disappointed on the first few uses. It didn't take long at all to dial in the preferred grind consistency. It's fairly quiet as well, I mean it does make noise but because it's a somewhat slow grind it's not loud like a blender or something like that. Overall very happy with this purchase so far. I didn't rate the durability because I haven't had it long but it seems pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Rapture2005

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level Burr Grinder
customer_reviews.text: It does a decent grind. I have a baratza virtuoso at home. Have a Cuisinart at work. Was not willing to spend $200 for a machine in the office. Was tired of the noisy inconsistent grind of the Cuisinart. This unit has a good recommendation on the Sweet Maria's site. It is really quiet. Does a nice consistent grind. It is not meant to do expresso grinds, which I am fine with. I do pour over at work. Just received it today. 1-2 cups 4 days a week. Should last for a very long time. Happy Friday.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Pechner

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it. Very unacceptable quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this grinder based on other reviews. I found that it is very slow, very lightly made. Basically junky. But despite that, if it did a good job, all would be forgiven. It is a horrible grinder. The coarsest it can grind is like polenta. The grind is not uniform and has a large amount of fines (coffee dust), making for a bitter cup. Back it went. The Bodum conical, BTW, Is much better, solid and a pretty decent grinder for the money.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Grinder the burns bright but goes out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well since Jan of 2020, around late this July it would make strange scraping and whirling sounds. I purchased insurance for this product. It is impossible to reach anybody through Asurion and I have been attempting to contact them for over a week. Not only is their site busted and refusing to put through a claim due to an error message but it seems nobody works the phones anymore? It's a decent burr grinder but its lifespan is not even close to the price I shelled out for it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and perfect grind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder for a pump espresso machine and wanted the ability to grind beans more finely than a standard grinder would do. This grinder puts out smooth and fine grinds and will even go fiber on the Turkish coffee selection if desired. The noise is minimal and sounds strong as it grinds. There is a little wasted coffee in the grinding chamber but it's minimal and easy to recover. Highly recommended for a coffee baller on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Abe Dedek

customer_reviews.title: Love the results
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder... you've got to deal with the noise and that it's a little hard to clean but it's my daily grinder. Super solid and reliable. I've bought two and would buy it again if it ever broke (it's bulletproof so I'm not expecting that).
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: Ten years and it's still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this grinder for over ten years now and it's still going strong! The steel grinding burrs are still like new and the grind is as clean and even as when it was brand new. We use it daily to grind our morning coffee and it has a place on our limited counter space. If this one ever breaks, I'll see if they can fix it and if not, I'll buy the newer version of the same grinder. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Dempsy Winans

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an electric grinder that does a proper Turkish
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two other burr grinders out there from top name brands and neither was able to produce the super-fine consistency of Turkish coffee like this grinder. I have only had it for a week but I have used it every day and if it continues to produce this level of quality for the next 2-3 years, I will be super happy. Highly recommend for those who want finely ground coffee (i.e. almost powder).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel James Gullo

customer_reviews.title: Great small grinder
customer_reviews.text: Compared this grinder with the Cuisinart and Bodum grinder and this is far superior in build quality. While this is usually used to grind for french press, I have also used it as a backup grinder for Nuova Simonelli Oscar II espresso machine and it grinds uniformly and more than fine enough with french roast coffee beans. The hopper is also much more functional than in the Cuisinart and just as static free as the Bodum. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put back together wrong
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder works great! Even grounds make for consistent French press every time. But, if you are like me, you clean your coffee grinder when you are getting ready to make your coffee in the morning. Which means you haven’t had your coffee yet. Which means it’s incredibly easy to put it back together wrong. Which renders the unit unoperational. Capresso-it might be good idea to make it so the burr grinder insert doesn’t fit in so easily upside down, and so it’s not absolutely impossible to get out if I do accidentally put it in upside down
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cold brew and pour over expeditions
customer_reviews.text: Grind settings work well. Way better than the manual grinder I was using for sure! I've used this product for a week now will update if anything happens. seems well built. I did have to clean it upon arrival because it was a bit dirty inside possibly from testing the product by grinding coffee beans at the factory. Read the Directions. Also Tip: dip a spoon into a glass of water shake off then stir beans this will alleviate some static from accumulating in the hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Jwat

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper grinders have been a nightmare. This gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchase the two most popular $40-$50 coffee grinders on amazon and had to return them both because of static cling, grinds shooting out all over, how much coffee got stuck in the grinder, and how inconsistent the fineness of the grounds were. This grinder is 100x better in every regard. Unless you want to go up 20-40 dollars, this is the best deal for your money. It pains me to say anything less expensive is almost unusable. I use this to grind beans for my pour over, and I have no complaints thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Green13

customer_reviews.title: Solid and consistent burr grinder for a little less
customer_reviews.text: Got this per the Wire Cutter's recommendation, it works great. Very consistent grind and friends have commented that it's slightly less noisy than their grinder. People have noticed that it's hard to predict how much coffee you're grinding. The numbers roughly correspond to 10g each, but it varies by how fine or coarse you're grinding the coffee. We get around the guessing by not keeping any beans in the hopper but measuring out on a scale exactly what we're going to grind each morning. Something to do while we wait for the water to boil.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 star but cleaning is a mess
customer_reviews.text: COVID meant that we couldn't get our favorite coffee. Well, her favorite coffee, which only came in whole bean that she ground at the store. We could buy direct and have it shipped, so I checked out several reviews for grinders and the Capresso Grinder rated very highly. I can't believe that people put the top grinder in upside down but life can be hard. This is a great grinder but they have nice polished plastic that guarantees static electricity will attract ground coffee to everything. It's not a deal-breaker by any means, just that you'll need about as much time to clean up as you did to grind.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Iaccino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to sit grind setting.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set grinding size, I am using to grind beans for cold brew machine and it works very well. One issue I do have with the grinder is the collecting cup gets very staticky and a lot of coffee shavings stick to it and therefore stick to the inside. It does come with a little brush for this very reason.
customer_reviews.author: SCPowers

customer_reviews.title: I want to like it more....
customer_reviews.text: Every part of me wants to like this more, however.....it's just not very "useful" Out of package: - Extra Fine setting is espresso fine -Coarse setting is.....about pour-over coarse. (Not useful for french press....) with a few internet searches you can "mod" the unit to be french press coarse...However, once you do that, the extra fine setting is not espresso fine.. In the end, this grinder is certainly not as versatile as I had hoped. I think it does great with consistent grounds, however the grind size range is frustrating to me. my 2 cents
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for fresh coffee bean grinding
customer_reviews.text: Best fresh bean grinder I've found for home use at a reasonable price. I had one for 12 years and moved it to another location. The new one is faster, quieter and grinds very evenly. My one small knock is that on the old model, I could move the grinding dial down if I accidentally set it too high. On this one, it won't budge downward unless it's almost finished grinding. Overall a quality product with a wide variety of grind settings from super fine to coarse coffee.
customer_reviews.author: RolidnotTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: When my Bodum Burr grinder burned out, I read ...
customer_reviews.text: When my Bodum Burr grinder burned out, I read a bunch of reviews and purchased this piece of junk. Two deal breaking design flaws 1) almost a full gram of coffee doesn't make it into plastic receptacle after each grind. You have to wack and wack the machine and remove the top each and every time to help the grinds make their way into the hole. It's ridiculous. 2). The cheap, plastic grinds receptacle is very poorly designed. What a weird shape. It makes it difficult to tap the grinds into your aeropress or v60 add there is both static cling and the sharp corners trap grinds. I am abandoning this thing and returning to the Bodum.
customer_reviews.author: Touchy

customer_reviews.title: My first foray into using a burr grinder is worth every penny and every moment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder. Easy to use, quiet and small enough that it doesn't take much counter space. The only annoying detail is a sort of gutter in the chamber that is a bit hard to clean every time I grind the coffee; they do give you a tiny little brush that more or less does the job. I bought a larger brush to brush off most of the grounds and I use the little one on that sort of groove or gutter along the bottom edge of the chamber. Worth all the trouble, the coffee you brew is great!
customer_reviews.author: Newburner

customer_reviews.title: Loud but a very good grind
customer_reviews.text: Produces a high quality uniform grind. I am super happy with it and use it nearly every day. I have a few nitpicks about the design though. You have to tap it a bit to get the last of the grounds out of the ceramic grinder and into the hopper, or else they spill out. The little plastic hopper that collects the grounds has two little cavities near the front. Grounds tend to collect in there and then pour out while trying to dump the contents into your coffee maker. It’s kinda loud. Overall though, a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kong

customer_reviews.title: Best price point for a quality burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter’s husband (she doesn’t drink coffee). I have the same model, purchased some years ago ... and this one is SO MUCH quieter than mine ... yet still has all the benefits of the outstanding burr grinding wheels. I am gonna have to replace mine now. The matte black finish is quite nice. My only gripe about this model is that everyone tends to grab it and move it by its coffee bin top ... which is how you adjust the grind texture ... so I am always having to readjust the grind, after the wife has grabbed the top to move the machine
customer_reviews.author: Fountain-head

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable, works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder off Amazon in 2008 and have used it virtually every day, normally either fine grind (moka pot) or coarse (french press). It has performed great this entire time. I must have put a 1,000 pounds of coffee through this thing by now. I recall the manual suggested taking it apart to clean after every use - I clean it about monthly and that's been fine so far. It's pretty loud, but not excessively so considering what it is doing.
customer_reviews.author: VMP

customer_reviews.title: Poor design wastes coffee
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job grinding, but... -The bean holder cracked within 2 weeks (replaced at no cost) -The design of the grinding chamber traps a significant amount of ground coffee (a couple of tablespoons) rather than delivering it all to the transparent bin, requiring it to be removed manually during cleaning. Unless it is cleaned thoroughly every day, that coffee becomes stale & should be discarded.
customer_reviews.author: Captains

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grind and immediately brew; easy to clean; much better than blade grinder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at recommendation of a friend to replace a cheaper blade model that didn’t last. Very happy with it. Easy to grind small amounts so that I can fresh grind for each coffee brew. I don’t have the most discriminating taste buds, but I was surprised how much better my coffee tastes with the conical burr and immediate brew after grinding. Easy to clean - I haven’t had the static charge problem that some have mentioned. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse & Very Good Grind Consistency
customer_reviews.text: Buying my 2nd one. The one I currently have is almost 5yrs old, I took it apart to clean and I put one piece in upside down -it will not forgive me. Cant get it apart w/out damaging. Nor can I go without a grinder. That's what I get for thinking about politics while doing something else. Agh! This grinder has been a work horse and performed very well for my pour over grinds (Chemex, Hario & MoccaMaster)-medium grind. I am a coffee devote'. And regularly brew up 5-7pots a day. It performs wonderfully and for it's price point......5 stars! Thankful for Prime one day delivery!!
customer_reviews.author: Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Good Burr Grinder for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I love this little burr grinder. Works well and it's super easy to adjust the grind. There is some static that creates a bit of a mess. They tell you to tap the machine in the instructions to prevent a mess, but I find that it does very little. You will need to clean out every 10 or so uses to prevent clogs. If it clogs in the middle of a grind it can be a big mess to try to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pair with a Delonghi Dedica espresso machine and it did not disappoint. I tried the finest setting and that choked my espresso machine out so I dropped it a few notches and it works fantastic. Just a few taps after grinding with it tilted forward and there doesn't seem to be much old grounds retention either. Look forward to trying this with a non-pressurized basket at some point too! Great value for money, no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon M.

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it did do a nice uniform grind
customer_reviews.text: Junk internal parts. Smoke from unit, motor burned up after 5-6 months home use (not quite daily for 6-8 cops). When it worked it did do a nice uniform grind, no problems with the loose coffee container problems in many of these reviews. Expected better quality product from Capresso. The Cuisinart I purchased for 1/2 price lasted me 5 years and my daughters is still using it 4 years later!! Not quite as uniform of a grind..
customer_reviews.author: Rand

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I had to experiment with the grind setting for my Klarstein Passionatta 20 BAR espresso machine(as indicated in the Capresso instructions), and found that the most coarse setting within the "fine" grind catagory works well. Any other setting results in either weak brew or no brew at all. Overall, this grinder works as it should. I have had no issues with cleaning or poor performance. It's too soon to comment on durability, so will update this review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: Consistent Clogging after 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: So the grinder works about as well as you would expect out the box. I can't comment on if the "coarse" or "fine" settings are industry standard -- for what it's worth, there is a difference in grind size based on the setting. This review is in regards to the cleaning of the unit. I grind coffee on average 1-2x a week. I didn't have to take the unit apart for cleaning the first time until about six months in. Then I had to clean it again two months later, and now I have to clean it again after about 3 weeks. I'm ordering a new grind unit from a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Madden

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning is messy but otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: The grind consistency is amazing. Makes a very good cup. It can grind through a large amount of beans very quickly as well. My main gripe is brushing/cleaning. Cleaning is kind of a pain because of the design. You will get coffee grounds all over your counter unfortunately. Haven't figured out a good way to keep my counters coffee free but other than that annoyance I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Decent if all you want is a consistent grind.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the reviews are correct when they mention that the grind size does not really match the size on the knob. It mostly grinds too fine. However all I needed it for was a consistent grind size for drip coffee. I set it at the absolute largest size possible and it works pretty well. Is it perfect for everything between French press and espresso? Definitely not. But it you want that, you have to be willing to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: still fairly fine. It is about the consistency of pre-ground coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: The coarsest grind is, as other post mention, still fairly fine. It is about the consistency of pre-ground coffee you can purchase in the store. It works in a coffee press, but it is not as coarse as I would like it. Also its build quality is a bit lacking. The plastic body feels rather cheap. On the other hand the grinder parts have some weight to them and seem robust. They also do a great job making a fine grind for espresso.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for 10 year old model
customer_reviews.text: I did notice that this model is a lot quieter that the previous unit we had for 10 years and the ground coffee container stays fully seated. Our old one we had to hold in place while grinding or the vibrations would shake the container our and ground coffee would pile up behind the container. Now if there was a way to keep the static discharge to a minimum to prevent coffee flying all over when you remove the container...Then it would be 5-★★★★★
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much time... but static
customer_reviews.text: This has saved me a ton to time and effort grinding fresh coffee beans in the morning, switching from a hand grinder. The only complaint is the grounds container. It’s plastic and gets charged up with so much static electricity in the grinding process. Also, the little corners of the curved front gather up grounds that build up. It takes an elaborate tapping process to get all of the grounds to settle to pour them out without spilling all over the counter, and if you fill the container up too much the static will make them spray everywhere when you pull it out of the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: I do love my coffee and have used many cheaper grinders
customer_reviews.text: I do love my coffee and have used many cheaper grinders. I have been using it for a while and have had no issues. It doesn't clog up and grinds well. I love very fine coffee and in the past the old cheap grinders would often clog up or just not do a very good job. Also, the little container does not have the static effect so many did. The coffee easily slides out and doesn't stick to the plastic. I am happy with my purchase. it does come with a little cleaning tool and a small measuring scoop as well.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great ginder
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Capresso 560. The first failed after 12 years of daily use. Capresso appears to have fixed my only two issues with the old one - the motor is significantly quieter now and they have fixed the static issue (so far anyway). The motor on the older one was so loud, it could be heard on the second floor at the other end of our house. The newer one is quiet enough that you can have a conversation while it's grinding. The grind quality is better than any other grinder at this price point. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Disagree with top rating
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this product is highly rated. It has performed very poorly for me. The grinds come out the same whether the setting is coarse or fine. The grinder simply fails to grind small quantities of beans at fine setting. The beans spin around in the grinding mechanism but don't pass through, leaving beans that must be dug out from the gears. At any setting, a lot of the coffee, once ground, fails to fall into the hopper. Ground coffee either builds up in the mechanism or falls out later in a heap on the counter. I've had cheaper, simpler, blade grinders that do a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: nova kitchen

customer_reviews.title: What a difference a mill makes!
customer_reviews.text: I received this coffee mill yesterday and immediately made myself a cup using my French Press. I had been using an old coffee mill from thirty years ago and did not like the way it would grind my beans due to the random size of the grind. I never fully appreciated the ability of my French Press until I used this new coffee mill. It was like night and day. The coffee is supreme! I believe the key is the uniform grind from this mill. I would recommend this coffee mill to anyone looking for an inexpensive coffee mill. It is well worth the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S.

customer_reviews.title: Wastes some of the ground coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This machine does grind beans slowly for a delicious cup of coffee, but too much of the ground coffee gets stuck in crevasses in the grinder, and some falls behind the receiving basket even when it is pushed in all the way. I have to spend more time brushing out and wiping up coffee grounds than I do any other part of making my morning cup. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lightseeker

customer_reviews.title: Lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model in 2016 for use in making espresso. It worked OK at first, at least compared to the blade grinders I've always used. It gets light use, about 10-12 espressos a week. But in the last six months I've been turning the grinder to increasingly "finer" settings in order to get the same espresso grind. It finally reached the end of its travel, so has been replaced. Some research online found this to be a common complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Tom N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am basically cheap and really debated about spending that money for a GRINDER for goodness sakes - but, I've had this for a several years now and I LOVE IT! The hopper was pretty tight at first, and I'm not sure how it changed, but one morning it just started sliding in and out easily. I've abused it terribly - have only cleaned maybe twice . . it just keeps working . .every morning my fresh coffee is wonderful. The grinding sound is even kind of soothing for me . .well, compared to the high whirring sound of my old blade unit. It sounds solid . reliable . .money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Brechie

customer_reviews.title: If you are serious about good coffee this is a reasonable buy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long enough to give 5 stars (which I only give products that are trouble free over a reasonable amount of time) but can say it has worked very well. Quiet compared to our other units. We french press every morning and are particular about our coffee and this unit has been easy to get the perfect grind. Only gripe is that coffee grounds stick a tad in the collection cup and when emptying into the carafe you get some grounds escaping onto the counter when you "tap" the sides to free the grounds. But worth putting up with IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Herb from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money just to make a mess
customer_reviews.text: Way too much static. Coffee grounds fly out and get everywhere. We used it for a while but got fed up with the mess it makes. So now it's in the pantry with all the other crap we don't use. It ground up coffee just fine but so does our little grinder that doesn't spray grounds everywhere that I have had for 15 years. Pulled that out after using the Capresso and apologized for trying to replace her.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be impossible to completely clean all the ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be impossible to completely clean all the old ground-up coffee out of this grinder. The tiny brush that they include is totally inadequate. The only way that might work would be to use a vacuum cleaner, because the coffee grounds are stuck in the burr, which is not removable. So, after the first time you use it, unless you are willing to use a vacuum cleaner to clean it, you'll have to put up with some old, stale coffee grounds being mixed with your freshly ground coffee. Yuk!
customer_reviews.author: cooljul

customer_reviews.title: Short life, made for a long residency in the dump
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about a year, now useless. Because it has no screws, I can’t take it apart myself, although I was able to disassemble it to the grinding mechanism. But since the safety switch prevents me from testing it until it’s completely reassembled, it’s an exercise in frustration to troubleshoot it. I hate throwing away things, but this is for the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Dobyns

customer_reviews.title: NOT dishwasher safe and NOT covered by warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grinder for about 9 months and wash the plastic parts in the dishwasher (top rack as stated in manual) once every few weeks. Now all the plastic parts have many cracks forming on them. To top it off, I was told that anything plastic is not covered by the 1-year warranty. So it is $85 to replace the plastic ($50 for bean container, $5 for its lid, and $30 for the grounds catcher). A new one is $95 on Amazon right now. When the parts break completely I'll just buy a new grinder, and it won't be another Capresso. Which is a shame because it is a good grinder and we have enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Thompson

customer_reviews.title: but it makes my coffee taste wonderful, so I think the grind is just fine
customer_reviews.text: Only received this yesterday, but my same model, which just died, lasted twelve years, so I have high hopes for this machine. The old one didn't actually die, but when I was cleaning it I did something wrong and could not put it back together properly. The bean holder got stuck. So the old machine could have gone on for years more. I know other reviews say the grind is not consistent, and to a point that is true, but it makes my coffee taste wonderful, so I think the grind is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: It works but the plastic cup is very fragile
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased 3 of these so far and we're officially done. It's a great function wise but the plastic cup that holds the coffee beans is very thin and fragile. We have broken it for a 3rd time and you can't be a replacement cup. As far as grinding beans goes, it works well. It is a little messy though.
customer_reviews.author: M Allen

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome, but annoying to clean
customer_reviews.text: There isn't really any way around the cleaning problem. It's a burr grinder; this is how they work. It makes a happy but loud noise when grinding. Not terrible, just not particularly quiet. Very easy to use, very nice grinder, so far, excellent results, really great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Splarch

customer_reviews.title: Motor broke after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder had a short but productive life, grinding coffee almost every day for about five years before dying abruptly last week. The burr stopped moving, and the motor made a low electrical hum when the dial was turned, as if stuck. After a few minutes of futzing with it, the hum stopped too. I took it apart and confirmed the problem was the motor. RIP. Unlike other reviewers I never had significant problems with the coarseness of the grind or grounds getting stuck in the machine. The grinder worked well while it lasted. Five stars for performance, quality, and value; minus two stars for not working anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is the burr grinder to get
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this burr grinder. I cannot believe how much a difference it makes in terms of overall taste. Way quieter and much cleaner that the other burr grinder we had been using. Yes, it does require frequent cleaning to maintain optimal performance, but given that it takes less than two minutes to do it, the pay-off is well worth the effort. Usually I give it a quick clean while waiting for my coffee to finish brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Sam James

customer_reviews.title: Extremely quiet, inexpensive,
customer_reviews.text: I saw it get an excellent review on Cooks Country , It is the best coffee grinder I've had, and is very affordable too. I had a conical burr [enhances coffee taste], by Cuisineart [more expensive] that couldn't do espresso grind . This grinder goes to Turkish coffee grind. It is whisper quiet which is invaluable at 630 am when I don't want to wake anyone. The grinds are very uniform and I'm loving getting more flavor out of the bean. Thank you Capresso!!
customer_reviews.author: greg v

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have been grinding Starbucks beans in this unit for almost a year and have found the unit to be consistent. We usually use a very fine grind and the machine has no problems producing the product. It is quite inexpensive compared to most other grinders and had exceeded our expectations
customer_reviews.author: Tbayteeth

customer_reviews.title: I *really* wanted to like this, in fact I did - but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I *really* wanted to like this, in fact I did - but the grind adjustment is useless, rather that fine to coarse it was medium to medium. I must have received a bad copy. Anyway I returned it and replaced it with an OXO Conical Burr Coffee Grinder and that has been *amazing* so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good conical burr grinder for this price point
customer_reviews.text: I looked carefully to find a reasonably priced grinder and decided to try this conical burr grinder for just a little more in cost above the disc burr grinders. I am so pleased with it. Very easy to use and clean, not too noisy and the espresso I make tastes so much better than my old cheap electric grinder. It does a nice fine grind. Fabulous conical grinder for the price!
customer_reviews.author: joyce chalfin

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for medium grind drip coffee on a Bunn 1 pot commercial coffee maker. I see many people complain about quality problems. I purchased in November 2012 so approximately 2000 pots of grinding I have found no faults. It has cost about $.04 per pot. Seems to only thing you get out of a much, much more expensive grinder is espresso grind which I do not want.
customer_reviews.author: Panama

customer_reviews.title: Lots of cleanup and lost grinds
customer_reviews.text: If I knew what I know now that I have used this grinder a bunch I would not have purchased it. It loses a ton of grinds inside the machine which leads not only to lost coffee but lots of cleaning. I still have my old reliable Krups blade grinder that I may replace it with if I get fed up with cleaning. It may not produce better grinds than a burr grinder but it isn't anywhere near the hassle of one, or at least this one. The medium and coarse settings grind finer than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This thing has become a book-end. I cleaned out the tray after every grind, but now all it does is make noise and smell like burnt plastic. I'm not sure if I can fully disassemble it to troubleshoot the issue. May increase the stars if I'm able to service it.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Dirty and Used!
customer_reviews.text: The coffee grinder arrived dirty - it had clearly been used and they didn't even bother to clean it. I'm not sure if it was the fault of the manufacturer or Amazon but I have already returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Brookdale

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this grinder. It puts out a consistent grind but I would like it to be a little coarser on the coarsest setting. I'm very displeased with the mess it makes. The static causes it to fly around and stick to everything. I let it sit for at least 15 minutes after grinding and it still makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: A really nice burr coffee grinder at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: A really nice burr coffee grinder at a reasonable price. The front compartment is a one-piece unit that fits tightly yet slides out easily to dump grounds without spilling coffee grounds all over the counter. The grinder itself is much quieter than most, allowing use in a home for early morning coffee while others are sleeping elsewhere behind closed doors. Cleaning is easy with parts that remove without difficulty. Someone put some thought into this product and it shows.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: Good burr grinder at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I use for drip grind and this grinder does an excellent job, especially with such a good price point..Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: thomas r paine

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This machine is amazing. I use it strictly for making espresso fine grind and it is PERFECT. The machine is fairly quiet and easy to use. There aren't too many moving parts in it. Just the two grinder pieces, the top container and the catcher for the grounds. Just set the timer, up to 10 and let it rip. So easy. Update; Dec, 2017 This machine is still going strong. I use it daily to grind espresso grounds. Some of the grounds tend to get stuck between the grinder and the bucket so I bounce it on the counter a couple of times when it’s close to done to ensure all the grinds come out. Still loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Best for home pour overs.
customer_reviews.text: Great for pour overs. I use it on my Kalita wave and Chemex. If you’re not doing espressos and not making commercial batches, this is the way to go. Very quiet so it won’t wake up the whole house in the morning. Just one issue that I’d like resolved — static cling on the cup. It’s not a dealbreaker though. I like it so much I bought another one to use at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: a plastic container makes this a three star product
customer_reviews.text: the container and outside of the grinder could have been made of a less static clingy material, so that the finely ground bits of the beans that are turned into little flakes don't become a messy coat on the outside of the grinder when you remove the container of your freshly ground beans from the machine
customer_reviews.author: thx1138

customer_reviews.title: Will not last long
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grinder since Oct 2019, two weeks ago it stop working. I cleaned it and done all the maintenance I'm able to do. It still will not work. Don't buy this product, it will stop working within a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Solis

customer_reviews.title: 10 Star Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I just viewed my purchase history with Amazon and was reminded that I ordered this machine on 28 Dec 2008. I use this machine 3 or 4 times a day as my family are big coffee drinkers. I would give this grinder 10 stars if Amazon authorized it. This is the best appliance I have ever purchased and it just keeps on ticking. Highly recommended for those who enjoy drinking freshly ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful, but you're always left with hard to clean grinds.
customer_reviews.text: After watching all the reviews from Whole Latte Love and reading reviews on here I knew this was the grinder for me. I've had it for a little over a month and so far it really grinds the beans evenly. It even comes with a little brush that'll help clean off excess grounds that are left behind. The ONLY complaint I have about the grinder is that you can never clean out ALL the grounds with the brush. I've tried removing the removable parts and tapped out all the excess grinds, but I can never get all of them. I'll be looking up better ways to clean it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L. Hollingshead

customer_reviews.title: My Son In Law was right!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing, quiet and efficient little grinder. After the first grind, the beans are uniform in size which was not the case with a previous burr grinder. If my husband gets up before me I can’t hear him grinding the beans! 😁. Coffee is so smooth and consistent now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grinding your own coffee makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: My husband has one of these that he's been using forever. He's a major coffee-snob (he roasts his own beans; he's actually roasting coffee beans as I write this review) and has tried other grinders, but this is his favorite. We just bought this for my brother as a gift, and I'm sure he'll never go back to pre-ground coffee (perish the thought!). This is really an excellent model and has survived frequent use for many years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this coffee maker since 2014. The only problem I have had was the timer selector, which is plastic, had broken. After the replacement, working great again. This was a bit noisy, and I'm cognizant that I may wake someone up, but this works very well for the coffee maker I use. Not too fine, but not coarse, either
customer_reviews.author: Lewis M. Brande

customer_reviews.title: The research paid off for a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: After months of research we finally took the plunge on the capresso coffee grinder. We've been using this everyday sometimes twice a day and are thrilled with it. We've had it almost 2 months. It is able to grind the coffee beans fine enough for my aeropress and large enough for my French press. Before this I was grinding the beans by hand so this is much faster. The static electricity on the collection container makes the grounds a little messy on the counter. But it's not to big of a deal to me. :) I definitely recommend this coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Grinds Coffee Well, But Hard to Clean Well
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works well to grind whole beans for cold brew. The grounds are coarse enough to be filtered through my cold brew device. However, the device is extremely difficult to clean. The grounds get very static and and they get stuck in the crevices of the device. Because you can't use water to clean the burr grinders, it's impossible to get all of the grounds out of the device; I imagine at some point the grounds will mold/dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Justin V

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect, but...
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is great at creating a uniform coffee size, and it's so much quieter than other grinders we've had. I would give this five stars except for one huge drawback: This grinder is a static machine. Removing the cup creates a cloud of supercharged coffee particles that adhere to hands, countertops, the grinder itself, the coffee pot, our cat, etc. Coffee grounds EVERYWHERE. It's so bad that we're looking for a replacement because of the mess.
customer_reviews.author: tmike

product_meta.title: Capresso Infinity Conical Burr Grinder, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

CAPRESSO - INFINITY CONICAL BURR GRINDER
ELEGANT, TIMELESS AND USER FRIENDLY DESIGN
For maximum aroma and flavor retention nothing beats the Infinity Conical Burr Grinder series. Computer controlled special grinding heads cut the angles and shapes of the steel burrs to within 0.1 mm precision (1/250 of one inch). Burrs are produced as matched pairs and are hand assembled in Switzerland for precise fit. The multiple gear motor produces the slowest grinding action (< 450 rpm) resulting in highest precision grinding from Turkish fine to percolator coarse. Lowest noise conical burr grinder.

Low Noise FEATURES & BENEFITS
 * Extremely wide range from Turkish fine to coarse for all kinds of coffee preparation.
 * Clearly marked fineness settings, 4 each for extra fine, fine, regular and coarse. A total of 16 settings.
 * Commercial grade solid conical steel burrs with advanced cutting design for high precision grinding.
 * Gear reduction motor grinds slow with reduced noise and little static build-up.
 * Slowest grinding speed in its class creates less friction and heat build up preserving maximum aroma and flavor in any grind setting.
 * Safety lock system.
 * Upper conical burr removable for easy cleaning.
 * Tight fitting ground coffee container (holds up to 4 oz. of ground coffee).
 * See through bean container holds up to 8.8 oz. of beans.
 * Timer can be set to grind from 5 to 60 seconds.
 * Cleaning brush and measuring scoop included.
 * Heavy duty zinc die-cast housing.

Easy to Use . Watts/Volts/Hertz: 100W/120V/60Hz

AMAZON.COM
For grinding larger quantities of coffee beans for a coffee-drinking crowd, Capresso's commercial-grade Infinity grinder handles 8-1/2 ounces of beans at a time. Sixteen different settings--four each in the four categories of extra fine, fine, regular, and coarse--let you adjust the grind to the specific blend of coffee and method of brewing. The finest setting is ideal for preparing Turkish coffee, which is a rare feature to find in a grinder. A built-in timer sets the grind for anywhere between 5 and 60 seconds so you can walk away without having to constantly press a button to continue the grinding process. The Infinity has an advanced conical burr design made of steel that is usually only found on commercial grinders. This burr design slows down the gears and reduces the amount of friction and heat to preserve coffee's flavor and aroma. The coffee container holds up to 4 ounces of grounds and remains sealed during grinding. For safety, the bean container also needs to be locked into place for the Infinity to operate. For easy cleaning, the bean container and upper burr lift off so you can clean the grinding chamber with the included brush and wipe down the heavy-duty zinc die-cast housing. The 100-watt burr grinder measures 7-2/3 by 5-2/5 by 10-4/5 inches and carries a one-year limited warranty. --Cristina Vaamonde

WIDE GRINDING RANGE: From ultrafine Turkish to French Press coarse and everything in between
PRESERVES AROMA: Gear reduction motor grinds slow with reduced noise and little static build-up
LARGE CAPACITY: 8.8 ounce bean container and 4 ounce ground coffee container.Watts/Volts/Hertz: 100W/120V/60Hz
EASY TO CLEAN: Removable upper burr allows access for easy cleaning
